Topic.Title: QCOM's margin pressure

Message.Msg: It's actually pretty easy to visualize Qualcomm's near-term and intermediate problems without even looking at any numbers. Three of QC's largest customers - Apple, Blackberry, and Nokia - have all missed current quarter guidance, it's simply common sense that QC would bear the consequences of their bad news. CYQ3 may not see a full recovery for some of them.

Topic.Title: Is ibexx right? More mobile download = good news?

Message.Msg: Omg. Dun u guys know how market works?! Even if news is baked in, it may and will likely gap down then rally off it. Its call sell the news buy the fact! This is big news and u expect share price to do nothing when it turns into a fact. So u expect Nvidia to always rally up and never have a 5% down day??? Even darn Apple and qcom have huge sell days during huge multi bagger rally up. And this, I am being optimistic. Recall when Nvidia won a spot in Surface Rt, and nexus 7, who would have thought this POS would be at only $13 after all these wins? Hence, being cautious and doubting it is the right thing to do . Not u blind faith followers thinking Nvidia is a religion!

Message.Title: Investing and Nvidia
Message.Msg: Heard of buy the rumors sell the fact, sell the rumors buy the fact? Hence, buy rumor that Nvidia won a spot in rt and nexus, then sell the fact, or let it continues to rally few days then sell it. So likely scenario, buy Nvidia after its announced they loses nexus 7 spot, or if it behaves poorly after opening, let it drop few days before buying. Most importantly, try to avoid supplier stocks, try to buy owner stocks. All semiconductor companies are supplier stocks. They supply to owners who sell directly to end consumers. Google, Msft, Apple, blackberry, ntes, bidu, lvs are all owner stocks. Owners only depend on end demand, suppliers have to depend on end demand and owners whims and fancies. Investing is tough enough, dun make it tougher.

Message.Title: Nvidias project Kai !
Message.Msg: Honestly bulls, which of Nvidias recent project is successful? Its always a launch, a hype, then nothing. Worse of it all is Kai, here's why. Isn't Nvidia the first to launch quad core, then announced kai to bring low cost quad to the masses??!!! Why only works in theory but lost so much to mediatek??!!! This is clear evidence of mismanagement . They misread market. They fail to realize that fabless industry has made barriers to entry lower and this is a commoditized product. Hence their bs premium quad and premium price can't compete. They have to realize this. But I believe Jen has an ego that is bigger than the room and will still price tegra too expensive to compete. Hence qcom margin compression may mean more volume business for qcom and mediatek. Whether tegra will benefit is questionable. Given half year mark is coming yet they have little or no business for tegra 4, it looks like lousy Nvidia again.

Message.Title: If winning Nexus is super great, losing it?
Message.Msg: Losing it becomes no big deal??? What kind of logic is the bulls trying to spin? Baffling! Well, fundamental it is significant. Chartwise, likely market already knows being a supplier, it is at owners fancies hence chart has been doing nothing for so long. If so, Nvidia will likely be an underperformed unless it transforms its business model successfully.

Topic.Title: MediaTek, QCom is selling quad-core chips for $10 according to digitimes.

Message.Msg: you only have to exit or keep losing big dough if you have nothing to bring to the party except hooking up ARM cores, which anybody can do. if you can do system, you do very good biz like appl and samsung. if you can do cheap, you do very good biz like mediatek. if you can enuf cheap radios, you do very good biz like brcm. their integrated strategy is 'almost fully proven' in my books. They are branching out beyond just samsung to India later this year. But the time they add China, I would consider it fully proven. My guess is they will do that in about one year's time. if you have other expertise, you turn to the embed market and add differentiate by adding other functionality to the soc. if you only have a loud mouth and nothing else, you just bleed.

Message.Title: Need a corp raider to split Nvidia into 2 companies
Message.Msg: Need 1 or 2 corp raider(s) to get the votes to split Nvidia and spin off the mobile business. It happened to Motorolla - split into the Moto Solutions (MSI) and the Moto Mobility (MMI) which was sold to Google. MSI has popped nicely since the split - double in MSI + MMI proceeds. This is just IMHO & Cheers!

Topic.Title: Nvidias project Kai !

Message.Msg: "Didn't Google dump Tegra and go with Qualcomm? lol" It might have more to do with NVDA not being able to meet Google's refresh date due to delay of resources being devoted to bringing up the release date of the T4i? If Q is so superior to Nvda as some here think, then why was T3 selected for the current Nexus? "You can't buy one Tegra 4 anything, all you can do with Tegra 4 is pump it on a message board TODAY." Since most new product releases are in the second half of the year, and that NVDA is forbidden to release any customer information, your apocalyptic assertion for T4 is a bit premature.
